item.title: Linux Find Command
item.description: Linux Find and Remove find . -name '.git' -type d -prune -exec rm -rf '{}' \; Here’s what it does: find . searches the current directory and its subdirectories. name '.git' matches files and directories named .git. type d makes the command only consider directories (since .git is a directory). prune prevents find from descending into the current file if it is a directory, which helps when you’re wanting to remove the directory itself.
